context_of_use: The system administrator manages clinical and administrative data to ensure centralized storage and integration with electronic medical records.
stakeholders_and_interests: system administrator: Ensure data integrity and availability
description: This use case allows the system administrator to store clinical and administrative data centrally and integrate electronic medical records into the hospital management system.
triggering_event: The system administrator initiates the management of clinical data.
preconditions: The system administrator is logged into the hospital management system.
postconditions: All clinical and administrative data is stored in the central database.
Electronic medical records are integrated with the management system.
assumptions: The central database has sufficient capacity to store all required data.
The integration process does not introduce new system functionalities.
requirements_met: The system shall store all data in a central database to reduce discrepancies between departments.
The system shall integrate electronic medical records with the management system to ensure digital availability of patient medical information.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on data migration procedures from old systems to the new system.
main_flow: 1. system administrator → The system stores all data in a central database.
2. system administrator → The system integrates electronic medical records with the management system.
information_for_steps: 1. Data to be stored in the central database.
2. Electronic medical records to be integrated.
